content.description: An impressive line along an arete with a great landing. Cracker Boy starts at large left facing flake and ascends along a series of gritty slopers to finish topping out over a broad overhanging face.
content.location: When walking up towards the fire lookout tower the boulder that Cracker Boy is on can be found off to the right a short ways. Cracker Boy is on the overhanging arete facing away from the tower itself.

content.description: long lockoffs between good crimps and flakes to straight forward topout
content.location: first face climb left of cracker boy

content.description:
A frustrating start on left facing sidepulls / flake moves up to... another left facing sidepull / flake.  Move past this flake and go for the top out.

Mind the branches while topping out.
content.location:
On the same boulder as Crackerboy, this route is found between

Buttermilk Face #3

and Buttermilk Face #1 (obviously...).  Look for the first obvious left facing flake / sidepulls to the right of Buttermilk Face #3 (#3 is an arete).

content.description:
Slopers and high feet marks the start to this arete problem.  Go up along the arete - two finish variations exist with both being about the same in grade and equally fun.

Mind the tree branches as you top out.

The problem is given a rating of V3 in drtopo's guide, but feels much easier for the grade.
content.location:
On the CrackerBoy Boulder (about 10 yards from the road), this is on the arete facing the lookout tower.

Several downclimbs options are available - all are to the left of this problem.

content.description:
Go up the low angled slab.

Note: this problem is mentioned as "unnamed" in topos / guides.  If anyone has the FA and the given name, I'm more than happy to change it.
content.location: Slabby face just left of Buttermilk Face #3 on the Crackerboy Boulder.

content.description:
An easy problem up along a series of rails, crimpers and jugs.  Several variations exist.

Also is a downclimb.

Note:  This problem is listed as "unnamed" in topos and guidebooks.  If anyone knows the FA and given name, I'm more than happy to change it to give credit where credit is due.
content.location: About 8' left of Buttermilk Face #3 on the Crackerboy Boulder.
